name: ListRequiredWorkflowRuns
description:
Retrieve all workflow runs for a required workflow.

Use this tool to list all workflow runs associated with a specific required workflow in a GitHub repository. It is useful for monitoring and analyzing the execution of required workflows. Requires repository read access, and for private repositories, an access token with the `repo` scope is needed.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository. Case sensitivity is ignored.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: required_workflow_id
parameters.description: The ID of the required workflow that has run at least once in a repository.

value_schema.description: The ID of the required workflow that has run at least once in a repository.

parameters.name: workflow_actor_username
parameters.description: Specify the username of the actor whose workflow runs you want to retrieve. Use the GitHub login for the user who initiated the push.

value_schema.description: Returns someone's workflow runs. Use the login for the user who created the `push` associated with the check suite or workflow run.

parameters.name: branch_name
parameters.description: Specify the branch name to filter workflow runs associated with it. Use the name of the branch from the `push`.

value_schema.description: Returns workflow runs associated with a branch. Use the name of the branch of the `push`.

parameters.name: trigger_event
parameters.description: Specify the event type that triggers the workflow run, such as `push`, `pull_request`, or `issue`.

value_schema.description: Returns workflow run triggered by the event you specify. For example, `push`, `pull_request` or `issue`. For more information, see "[Events that trigger workflows](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/events-that-trigger-workflows)."

parameters.name: workflow_run_status
parameters.description: Specify the workflow run status or conclusion to filter results. Options include 'completed', 'in_progress', 'success', etc.

value_schema.description: Returns workflow runs with the check run `status` or `conclusion` that you specify. For example, a conclusion can be `success` or a status can be `in_progress`. Only GitHub can set a status of `waiting` or `requested`.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of workflow run results to display per page, with a maximum limit of 100.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: results_page_number
parameters.description: The page number of the results to fetch, used for pagination of the workflow runs.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

parameters.name: workflow_runs_created_date_range
parameters.description: Specify the date-time range to filter workflow runs based on their creation date. Use GitHub's date search syntax for formatting.

value_schema.description: Returns workflow runs created within the given date-time range. For more information on the syntax, see "[Understanding the search syntax](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/search-github/getting-started-with-searching-on-github/understanding-the-search-syntax#query-for-dates)."

parameters.name: check_suite_identifier
parameters.description: Specify the Check Suite ID to filter workflow runs associated with this specific ID.

value_schema.description: Returns workflow runs with the `check_suite_id` that you specify.

parameters.name: sha_for_head_commit
parameters.description: Returns workflow runs associated with the specified head SHA (commit identifier).

value_schema.description: Only returns workflow runs that are associated with the specified `head_sha`.

parameters.name: exclude_pull_requests
parameters.description: If true, pull requests are omitted from the response.

value_schema.description: If `true` pull requests are omitted from the response (empty array).

value_schema.description: Returns workflow runs with the check run `status` or `conclusion` that you specify. For example, a conclusion can be `success` or a status can be `in_progress`. Only GitHub can set a status of `waiting` or `requested`.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: head_sha
